header.title: The Scroll of Set - September 1995
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Left-Hand Path

central_thesis: This Scroll of Set presents a comprehensive overview of Setian philosophy and practice, emphasizing individual self-transformation (Xeper) as the core purpose. It details how Xeper is driven by a dialectical interplay between the Set and Horus principles, requiring the conscious confrontation and integration of 'discord' for growth, and sustained by continuous 'Work' that synthesizes subjective experience with objective reality. The Heb-Sed Year is highlighted as a foundational framework for this ongoing process of renewal and the 'shaping of time' by the Elect, contextualizing Setian magical operations within a broader esoteric and ethical paradigm.

structure_content.summary: This article proposes that the Set and Horus principles engage in an alternating dialectical relationship of opposition and harmony. Set, representing isolate intelligence and psychecentric individuality, acts upon Horus, representing the content of the psyche, to drive initiatory movement and the evolution of consciousness. This process, initiated by Set, is crucial for transcending static states and fostering continuous psychic growth.

This contribution defines the Heb-Sed Year as a significant Setian action focused on 'shaping of time'. It outlines two paths: the 'Daylight Path' (HarWer/Elder Horus) for goal-oriented transformation through accepting challenges and respecting the world's rhythms, and the 'Night Path' (Set) for developing preparedness and daring by knowing one's life goals and trusting one's inner divinity. The unification of these paths (Samtaui) enables Setians to integrate rational and supra-rational planning, becoming 'makers of time'.

This article describes the ritual performed at the Set-XVI Conclave, involving invocations of Set and Horus. It highlights the disclosure of 'Harmony' as the 'Secret of the Two Partners,' which serves to link the subjective and objective aspects of existence. The ritual utilizes the Black Flame and references tools such as the Pesh-en-Kef knife and the pentagram averse, connecting Setian practice to ancient Egyptian wisdom and Pythagorean philosophy.

The author discusses the necessity of extending Xeper, or self-transformation, beyond the 'sublime self' experienced in ritual to the 'mundane self' in the 'real world'. Xeper is presented as a holistic process encompassing the entirety of one's being. The focus shifts to 'Remanifesting' internal transformations externally, allowing lessons learned in esoteric realms to integrate and reorder the 'World of Horrors,' leading to a core experience of joy and strength.

This piece redefines 'discord' not as something to be resolved, but as a 'mystery' with inherent magical power, essential for Xeper. Drawing on the Tarot 'Tower' card (radical change), the Rune Raidho (vehicle for cosmic power), and the I Ching's 'One Fixed Law' (change), it advocates for embracing and exploring contrariness rather than merely reconciling opposites. Differences are presented as energetic drivers for individual and collective transformation within the Temple.

This article argues for the existence of Set as a real, intelligent entity, moving beyond mere faith. It posits that mankind's unique evolution serves as proof, and that the Temple of Set, by acting according to Set's will in the objective universe, makes Set a reality. The 'Gift of Set' is identified as the ability to Xeper and Remanifest as more perfect beings.

The author explores the conceptual opposite of Xeper, suggesting 'Xeper' (lowercase) or 'xeper' as a provisional term. Influenced by Derrida's deconstructionism, the article notes that meaning involves identity and difference, implying that Xeper's essence is continually 'deferred'. This theoretical exploration aims to define Xeper more precisely by contrasting it with its conceptual counter-forces, emphasizing a dynamic, self-generating aspect within the Æon of Xepera.

This report emphasizes the universal nature of the Left-Hand Path (LHP), derived from the Sanskrit *vama marg*, asserting its independence from specific cultural manifestations, including Satanism. It describes the Set-XVI Conclave as a transformative 'experience' rather than a mere meeting, highlighting the diversity and 'Night Eternal' theme, symbolizing continuous Xeper and Remanifestation within the Setian Empire.

This article provides detailed Setian definitions for three core terms: Xeper, Work, and Perspective. Xeper is defined as an experience-based understanding of self-creation. Work encompasses all Setian activities (study, ritual, dialogue) for self-knowledge and discovery, described as the active process leading to Xeper. Perspective refers to the evolving understanding gained through Work and Xeper, leading to continuous reevaluation and further self-discovery in a cyclical process.

This article frames Setian existence as a struggle against cosmic entropy. It posits that only individuals possessing 'isolate, independent intelligence' can yearn for purpose, resisting the universe's tendency toward chaos. This conscious struggle is vital for purifying the 'Black Flame' and creating Black Magicians, who embrace the 'Gift of Set' – intrinsic to human being but antinomian to conventional cosmic order.

The author proposes a Setian 'meta-UFT' for human experience, aiming for a comprehensive explanation of consciousness, bodily incarnation, and existence. Unlike Einstein's physical UFT, the Setian meta-UFT is complex, involving both objective and individual subjective universes. It suggests that 'enlightened creations' are expressions of the Gift of Set, coalescing into an adventure toward this meta-UFT, enabling the 'Setamorphic Metamind' to correlate all its diverse contents.

key_concepts.definition: The core Setian concept of self-creation, self-transformation, or 'Coming Into Being'. It is a holistic process encompassing both internal ('sublime self') and external ('mundane self') manifestations, achieved through dedicated 'Work' and an evolving 'Perspective'.

A period of renewal and 'shaping of time' within the Temple of Set. It involves two complementary paths: the 'Daylight Path' (active, goal-oriented transformation) and the 'Night Path' (inward preparedness and trusting one's divinity). The unification of these paths (Samtaui) allows Setians to integrate rational planning with supra-rational vision.

A dynamic philosophical model where Set (isolate intelligence, individual self-consciousness) and Horus (the content of the psyche, thoughts, feelings) engage in an alternating relationship of opposition and harmony. This interplay generates initiatory movement and the evolution of consciousness.

A concept that reinterprets differences and conflicts not as problems to be resolved, but as a magical 'mystery' to be explored. Discord possesses inherent magical power, providing the necessary energetic 'push and pull' for Xeper and transformation, rather than requiring reconciliation.

The inherent spark of isolate, independent self-consciousness within each individual. Its purification is a central goal, achieved through the conscious struggle against cosmic entropy and the continuous maintenance of a distinct identity.

A universal and independent system of self-deification and individual will, fundamentally distinct from any single cultural or religious manifestation (e.g., Satanism). Its focus is on personal Becoming and mastery, rooted in the Sanskrit term 'vama marg'.

The active, deliberate engagement in practices and efforts leading to self-knowledge and self-discovery. This includes study, ritual, writing, dialogue, Lesser and Greater Black Magic, and participation in Pylons/Orders, all contributing to the process of Xeper.

A practical magical application where an 'internal curse' is directed at a 'dæmonic remnant' (negative psychological residue like hatred or inadequacy) left by an injurer within oneself, using the Black Flame for subjective purification. The Red Flame is used to address external barriers to Xeper in the phenomenal world.

A concept from the Setian 'meta-UFT' (Unified Field Theory) which refers to the unique human ability, derived from the Gift of Set, to consciously correlate all the diverse contents of one's experience and being, enabling a profound and exhilarating understanding of existence.

practical_system.description: The practical system elucidated across these articles centers on individual self-transformation (Xeper) driven by active 'Work'—a continuous process of self-knowledge and self-discovery. This involves both internal psychological integration (purification of the Black Flame) and external manifestation in the 'real world'. Practitioners are encouraged to consciously exercise their 'isolate intelligence' in a dialectical engagement with their psyche, transforming 'discord' into magical energy. The Heb-Sed Year provides a structured framework for setting goals, embracing challenges, and aligning personal will with cosmic rhythms. Ethical considerations, particularly regarding curses, are framed within the context of removing subjective and objective barriers to Xeper. The ultimate aim is to achieve 'Remanifestation' and the 'shaping of time' by consciously evolving one's being.

relevant_quotes.text: If reduced to a philosophical or metaphysical principle, Set would represent the principle of isolate intelligence or individual self consciousness that is centered in itself. That is, Set would be each person's psychecentric individuality and independence. Horus, then, would represent the principle of that which revolves around this psychecentric center: the universe of thoughts, feelings, and the content of psychic activity.

The moving force in the initiatory process is the Set principle. It is Set acting upon the content of our psyches that permits initiatory progress. It might also be noted that if the foregoing is valid, then all initiation would involve Set as the initiating factor: Set, the Lord of the Left-Hand Path.

This is a path that requires respect for the world, and respect for worthy beings along the way. It requires an Understanding of the world, and the ability to make use of the world's rhythms and forces as part of one's planning. This is half of the Mystery of the Shaping of Time.
With this knowledge you can lift yourself out of ruts, heal your soul, and change the manifestations of the world before your eyes. Hold this knowledge dear, and the Key of Xepera is yours.
The first Temple-wide working of the Heb-Sed Year was the creation of the Eternal Set network, which will manifest on January 1, XXXI (1996 CE).
The Secret was disclosed: the secret of Harmony.
Thus if Xeper is the Xeper of the whole of our beings, and I believe that it is, then it is impossible to Xeper in one world alone.
Differences have a magical power, beyond any philosophical consideration, that contributes to Xeper on an individual basis as well as for the larger Temple.
The most exhilarating thing in the world, I think, is the ability of the Setamorphic Metamind to correlate all its contents. Let's do it.
The Left-Hand Path is universal, independent of any one cultural manifestation of it, including Satanism.

Work is all thing things we do as Setians in our search for self-knowledge and self-discovery... Our work is what we do, it is the process by which we come to see and understand. And Xeper is the result. Xeper will come naturally to those who attend to their personal work in their search for self-knowledge. If we find ourselves focusing only on Xeper, we are looking in the wrong direction. The focus must be on our work, and Xeper will follow.

When you exercise isolate intelligence as separate from the agenda of the cosmic conductor – when you squarely face the megalomania of that "singular consciousness now called God" – you begin to realize what a singular and exceptional Gift self-awareness directed by will truly is.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles from 'The Scroll of Set' is highly relevant to Western Esotericism, specifically the philosophical and practical currents of the Left-Hand Path and Setianism. It provides deep insight into the Temple of Set's unique concept of Xeper as comprehensive self-creation, detailing its operative mechanics through dialectical processes, the ethical considerations in magical practice (e.g., curses), and the communal yet individualistic nature of Setian initiation. The discussions on 'Discord' as a source of magical power, the universal nature of the LHP beyond cultural specificities, and the 'Setamorphic Metamind' offer sophisticated theoretical contributions to modern occult thought, bridging ancient wisdom with contemporary psychological and magical paradigms.
critical_analysis.target_audience: This collection targets initiates and prospective members of the Temple of Set, providing foundational and advanced philosophical guidance for their personal Xeper. It is also highly valuable for academics studying modern Western Esotericism, particularly Setianism and the Left-Hand Path, offering primary source material on its doctrines and practices. Additionally, independent occultists and practitioners of self-transformation seeking robust theoretical frameworks and practical insights into consciousness development will find significant value in these texts.
